projects.description: This project shows a quote randomly selected from an array. The quotes and background color will change every 10 seconds or will change with the click of a button.  The quotes will be authored either by Jane Austen, Charles Dickens, or Oscar Wilde.

For this project, I used JavaScript to paginate a long list of students and implement a search form to find students by name. The first screen shot shows a list of 54 students paginated 10 per page.  The second screen shot shows a search form that will filter students by name as you type in the search form field.

This is a form validation project, done without using HTML5 validation. Validation is done using jQuery and Regular Expression tests.  The first screen shot shows the message that will appear if the form is submitted without all fields being validated.  The second screen shot shows that the form will not allow registration for activities that occur at the same time -- when an activity is clicked, an activity ocurring at the same time will be disabled.  The third screen shot shows an error message that will occur if payment information is entered with no activity chosen.
